comments:
I20040519

* No progress dialog was shown when I pressed "search" on the installed JREs 
pref page (don't know where it went)
* The busy cursor appeared and there was no way to cancel the search
* Since I had selected to search my C drive, this was very bad (long op)

I found the progress dialog hiding behind some windows - perhaps it was not 
opened on the correct shell.

The progress dialog should never show up behind other shells - moving to 
platform UI.

I didn't have a progess dialog until I closed/cancelled the Preferences page.  
The progress dialog appeared and then I could cancel that too.

If you search for JREs there is also a prgress dialog. The progress dialog 
after closing occurrs if you change the default JRE (which causes a re-build). 
However, if you try searching an entire drive, you should see what I mean.

I didn't notice all the stack traces in my log....

The NPEs are a separate bug not related to this problem.  However, I do see 
that the progress monitor status in the corner is constantly flickering saying 
Open progress monitor, but I don't see anything.

Hmm, slight problem with the fix....

I am seeing a blank Progress Dialog appear with no information other than 
Operation in progres....

If I turn on verbose for the Progress View, if I catch it, it usually appears 
as sleeping.

This is because the API is not choosing the do

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 62757 ***
